conclusion: An ideal gas undergoes three processes A→B, B→C, and C→A, returning to state A. Temperature at state A is 200K.
The diagram shows processes A→B, B→C, and C→A.
A→B is an isochoric process, B→C is an isobaric process, C→A is an isothermal process.
The ideal gas law is PV = nRT.

premise: A→B is isochoric. Use PA/TA = PB/TB.
B→C is isobaric. Use VB/TB = VC/TC.
C→A is isothermal. Temperature remains constant.
conclusion: Temperature at state A should equal temperature at state C.
The temperature of the gas at state C is 500 K.
